utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey you guys I got some bad news.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well that’s no way to sell newspapers. Why don’t you try, "Extra! Extra! Read all about it!"

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, Monica’s restaurant got a horrible review in the Post. I didn’t want her to see it, so I ran around the neighborhood and bought all the copies I could find.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Man, this is bad! And I’ve had my share of bad reviews. I still remember my first good one though. "Everything else in this production of Our Town was simply terrible. Joey Tribbiani was abysmal."

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God! Look at all the newspapers! It must be a good review! Is it great?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Umm…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh dear God!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: But the good news is, no one in a two-block radius will ever know.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What about the rest of Manhattan?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, they all know.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God, this is horrible!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m so humiliated!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah but y’know what they say Mon, "There’s no such thing as bad press."

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You don’t think that umm, "The chef’s Mahi Mahi was awful awful," is bad press?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I didn’t write it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Is he right? Am I really—Am I awful?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah! Yeah Monica! You listen to me, okay? And I’m not just saying this because I’m your friend, I’m sayin’ it ‘cause it’s the truth. You’re food is abysmal!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?! What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I am freaking out!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Are ya?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: My due date is in one week!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What are you doing up?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That is seven days!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay look, I had a lot of water before I went to bed. Can we do this after…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No-no-no-no-no Ross! Please, come on we do not have any of the big stuff we need! We do not a changing table! We do not have a crib! We do not have a diaper service!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It’s funny you should mention diapers.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m serious.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay look, there’s nothing to worry about. We have plenty of time. There’s a great baby furniture store on west 10th. Tomorrow, we will go there and we will get you everything that you need. Okay?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay. Thank you. That’s great. Thank you. Wait-wait! Where on west 10th? Because there’s this really cute shoe store that has like this little…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay. Okay. If uh, if you’re gonna do this, then I’m gonna do that. So…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, wait Ross! I’m sorry, one more thing!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Umm, our situation. Y’know umm, what we mean to each other. And I mean we-we’re having this baby together, and we live together. Isn’t that, isn’t that weird?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well uh…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m just kidding! You can go pee!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey uh Monica, I can’t remember. Did we say we were gonna meet here or at the movies?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We said at the movies, but…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll see you there.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey! Now that you’re here…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Sure, I can hang out ‘til I have to meet ya. What uh—How come you’re not going?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I have a job interview I have to get ready for.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I thought you already have a job.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And people say you don’t pay attention. No, this is a much better job. It’s vice-president of a company that does data reconfiguration and statistical factoring for other companies.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wow! How do you know how to do that?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That’s what I do now.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey Joey, come taste this.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Remember that guy that gave me a bad review? Well… I’m getting my revenge!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You cooked him?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No. He teaches a course on food criticism at the New School, so before we go to the movies I wanna go by there and make him try my bouillabaisse again. Oh, I cannot wait to read the front page of the Post tomorrow! "Restaurant reviewer admits: I was wrong about Monica."

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: The front page? You really do live in your own little world, don’t ya?

utterance.speaker: Cashier
utterance.content: Do you uh, want these things delivered Mr. and Mrs. Geller?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No-no-no! No, no, no, we’re not married.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: We are having a baby together, but we’re not involved. I mean, uh we-we were seeing each other a while ago, but then we were just friends. And then there was one drunken night. Or, yes stranger, we’d like this delivered please.

utterance.speaker: Cashier
utterance.content: Why don’t you fill out this address card.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, okay.

utterance.speaker: Cashier
utterance.content: I notice you picked out a lot of our dinosaur items.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh yeah! Actually, that’s one of the reasons why we’re not a couple.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I chose those, I’m a paleontologist.

utterance.speaker: Cashier
utterance.content: Really?! That is so cool!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh. Oh yeah, don’t get to worked up over it. I mean it-it sounds like he’s a doctor, but he’s not.

utterance.speaker: Cashier
utterance.content: Oh no-no, I’m fascinated by paleontology. Have you read the new Walter Alvarez book?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah! I-I teach it in my class.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God! I’m standing at a cash register, holding a credit card, and I’m bored.

utterance.speaker: Cashier
utterance.content: Oh, I love your neighborhood. There’s a great gym right around the corner from your building.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s my gym.

utterance.speaker: Cashier
utterance.content: I can tell you work out. A paleontologist who works out, you’re like Indiana Jones.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I am like Indiana Jones.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi Pheebs!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey! Oh, how did baby shopping go?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, it was great! We got everything that we needed! Oh and Ross, almost got something that wasn’t on the list. A whore.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, we were paying for our stuff and this saleswoman just started flirting with him.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well did she know you two weren’t married?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God! Well the idea of a woman flirting with a-with a single man, we-we must alert the church elders!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You don’t understand! You didn’t see how brazen she was.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Sounds like you’re a little jealous.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No! I’m not! I-I-I just think it’s wrong! It’s-it’s that I’m—Here I am about to pop and he’s out picking up some shop girl at Sluts ‘R’ Us!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Is that a real place? Are they hiring?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey Phoebe! Fatty!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey Chandler, why so fancy?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I got a job interview. It’s kinda a big deal too. Its a lot more money and I’d be doing data reconfiguration and statistical factoring.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wait, I think I know someone who does that.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Me! I do that. So… Seriously, do I look okay? I’m little nervous.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh yeah! You really—You look great.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, just don’t get your hopes up.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, the interview…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What about it?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Y’know! You don’t make a very good first impression.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh you don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Are you serious?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes, when I first met you, you were like, "Blah, blah, blah." I was like, shhh!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What is it that I do?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well it’s just like you’re trying too hard. Always making jokes, y’know, you just—You come off a little needy.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Did you like me when we first met?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Chandler, I’m not gonna lie to ya, but I am gonna run away from you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi! Umm, I’m Monica Geller, I’m the chef at Alessandro’s.

utterance.speaker: The Food Critic
utterance.content: Still?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I think the things that you said about me are really unfair, and I would like for you to give my bouillabaisse another chance.

utterance.speaker: The Food Critic
utterance.content: I don’t see any reason why I would do that to myself again.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Either eat it, or be in it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Spoon? So, what do you think?

utterance.speaker: The Food Critic
utterance.content: I’m torn, between my integrity and my desire to avoid a beating. But I must be honest, your soap is abysmal.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thata girl! Huh? We should get out of here; there’s a new class comin’ in.

utterance.speaker: The Cooking Teacher
utterance.content: Welcome to introduction to cooking. Now, before we start, can anyone tell me the difference between a hollandaise sauce and a bearnaise sauce?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I can.

utterance.speaker: The Cooking Teacher
utterance.content: Okay, go ahead.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well umm, they both have a egg yolk and butter base, but a bearnaise has shallots, shirvel, and most importantly tarragon.

utterance.speaker: The Cooking Teacher
utterance.content: That’s very good, what’s your name?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Monica.

utterance.speaker: The Cooking Teacher
utterance.content: Monica, you go to the head of the class.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All this stuff takes up a lot of room. Hey how uh, how serious are you about keeping Ben in your life?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: My son? Pretty serious. Oh hey Katie! What uh, what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Katie
utterance.content: Well, the delivery went out to you and I realized they forgot this.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ah, must’ve been fairly obvious since it was the only thing left in your store.

utterance.speaker: Katie
utterance.content: Listen, to be honest, home deliveries are really a part of my job description.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Katie
utterance.content: Oh uh…I actually came here to ask you out.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh! Wow! Uh, yeah! That sounds great. I’m just gonna put this back in my pocket, pretend that didn’t happen. Uh yeah, actually I’m free now. Do you wanna grab some coffee or…

utterance.speaker: Katie
utterance.content: Sure!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Horny bitch. No! You’re a horny bitch! Noooo! You’re the horny bitch! No! You’re a horny bitch!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So you guys go, have a really good time.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m just gonna grab my coat. And uh, and my whip. Y’know because of the Indiana Jones? Not-not because I’m-I’m into S I’m not-I’m not into anything weird. Y’know? Just-just normal sex. So, I’m gonna grab my coat.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So, you had a good day huh? Big commission; picked up a daddy.

utterance.speaker: Katie
utterance.content: Are you okay with this?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh yeah! Yeah please, you guys have fun.

utterance.speaker: Katie
utterance.content: Okay. It was nice to see you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh and it was great to see you too. And you look fantastic, although you missed a button.

utterance.speaker: Katie
utterance.content: Oh umm, actually I umm…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh okay, I see what you’re doing there.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I can’t even believe this! I really come off that badly?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh! It’s okay, you calm down after a while and then people can see how really sweet and wonderful you really are.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh good. Good, because I’m sure this interview is gonna last a couple of weeks.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right, don’t freak out! Okay? I-I will help you. How long before you have to leave?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: An hour.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I can’t help you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Phoebe!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right, all right, we’ll just do our best. Okay? So let’s say I’m the interviewer and I’m meeting you for the first time. Okay. "Hi! Come on in, I’m uh, Regina Philange."

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Chandler Bing.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Bing, what an unusual name.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well you should meet my uncle, Bada. I’ll let myself out.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: The Cooking Teacher
utterance.content: Your Fettuccini Alfredo looks a little dry, did you use all your cheese?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: When you say used, do you mean eat as a pre-cooking snack?

utterance.speaker: The Cooking Teacher
utterance.content: And the cream?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Cheese makes me thirsty.

utterance.speaker: The Cooking Teacher
utterance.content: Okay. Let’s move on.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: The Cooking Teacher
utterance.content: Oh! Something smells good over at Monica’s station! Oh my God! This is absolutely amazing! You’ve never made this before?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh no! I don’t know anything about cooking. I had to ask someone what it’s called when the, when the water makes those little bubbles.

utterance.speaker: The Cooking Teacher
utterance.content: Well, hats off to the chef.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I-I-I’m sorry, your-your mouth was full, I didn’t hear what you said. Umm, hats off to who now?

utterance.speaker: The Cooking Teacher
utterance.content: The chef!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That’s right.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: …I think you’ll find if I come to work here, I don’t micro-manage. I don’t shy away from delegating.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Um-hmm, that’s good to know. But let’s stop focusing on what you don’t do, and start focusing on what you do do.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What I do do…is manage to uh, create an atmosphere of support for the people working with me.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I see. Nice sidestep on the do do thing by the way.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hardest thing I’ve ever done in my life.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You gotta go!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, don’t worry. You’re ready.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Absolutely! Just fight all your natural instincts and you’ll be great.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: The Cooking Teacher
utterance.content: Ah Monica, my star student.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Y’know, you called me that before so I-I took the liberty of fashioning a star out of aluminum foil. Now, no pressure, you like my cookies, you give me the star.

utterance.speaker: The Cooking Teacher
utterance.content: Oh, yum-yum-yum.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wow! A star! I know you all hate me and-and I’m sorry, but I don’t care.

utterance.speaker: The Cooking Teacher
utterance.content: Okay Joey, you’re up next. This are good! This is amazing! You get an A!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I can an A? In-in school? Hey, I’m a dork.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey! I’m so proud of you!

utterance.speaker: The Cooking Teacher
utterance.content: I think you should give him your star.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Excuse me? He doesn’t even know what he’s doing!

utterance.speaker: The Cooking Teacher
utterance.content: We’re all beginners here. Nobody knows what they’re doing.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I do! I’m a professional chef! Oh relax! It’s not a courtroom drama!

utterance.speaker: The Cooking Teacher
utterance.content: If you’re a professional chef, what are you doing taking Introduction to Cooking?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m-I’m sorry, it’s just that umm… Well I-I cook at this restaurant, Alessandro’s, and umm I just got a really bad review…

utterance.speaker: The Cooking Teacher
utterance.content: Oh Alessandro’s! I love that place!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You do?

utterance.speaker: The Cooking Teacher
utterance.content: Oh yes! You’re an excellent chef! As a person you’re a little…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, I’m totally crazy, but you-you like the food?

utterance.speaker: The Cooking Teacher
utterance.content: Very much.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay then, I don’t stink. I’m a good chef. Okay.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa! I don’t want to go. I’m having fun.

utterance.speaker: The Cooking Teacher
utterance.content: Well actually, did either of you pay for this class?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey-hey-hey, if my friend says it’s time to go, it’s time to go.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: …also I was the point person on my company’s transition from the KL-5 to GR-6 system.

utterance.speaker: The Interviewer
utterance.content: You must’ve had your hands full.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That I did. That I did.

utterance.speaker: The Interviewer
utterance.content: So let’s talk a little bit about your duties.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: My duties? All right.

utterance.speaker: The Interviewer
utterance.content: Now you’ll be heading a whole division, so you’ll have a lot of duties.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I see.

utterance.speaker: The Interviewer
utterance.content: But there’ll be perhaps 30 people under you so you can dump a certain amount on them.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Good to know.

utterance.speaker: The Interviewer
utterance.content: We can go into detail…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No don’t I beg of you!

utterance.speaker: The Interviewer
utterance.content: All right then, we’ll have a definite answer for you on Monday, but I think I can say with some confidence, you’ll fit in well here.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Really?!

utterance.speaker: The Interviewer
utterance.content: Absolutely. You can relax; you did great.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah I gotta say thank you, I was really nervous. Y’know I’ve been told I come on to strong, make to many jokes, and then it was really hard to sidestep that duty thing. Duties. Duties! Poo.

utterance.speaker: The Interviewer
utterance.content: Poo?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh my God this doesn’t count! Okay? The interview was over, that was the real Chandler Bing in there, this is just some crazy guy out in the hall! Call security! There’s a crazy guy out in the hall!

utterance.speaker: The Interviewer
utterance.content: Poo?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’ll look forward to your call.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi! You’re back from your date!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: How are you?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m fine, but that’s not important. What’s important is how was she?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uhh, it was fun. We, we just had coffee.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh uh-huh, uh-huh, coffee, a little rub-rub-rub under the table.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What’s uh, what’s going on? Do you not, do you not like Katie?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No! No, she’s—She was nice. I mean, she’s a little slutty, but who isn’t?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I liked her.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Of course you did Ross, you would date a gorilla if it called you Indiana Jones!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Did you get like a fresh batch of pregnancy hormones today?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No! It’s just that, Kate bothered me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Why? What was wrong with her?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: There was nothing wrong with her! All right? She was perfectly lovely!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, so what’s the matter?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don’t want you to date her!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Why? What, what are you jealous?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes! And not because I want you to go out with me, but because I don’t want you to go out with anybody! Okay? I know it’s a terrible thing to even think this, and it’s completely inappropriate, but I want you to be at my constant beck and call 24 hours a day! I’m very sorry, but that is just the way that I feel.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I won’t date. I’ll uh, I’ll be here, with you, all the time.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really? But I’m being so unreasonable.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: True, but you’re allowed to be unreasonable. You’re having our baby.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh Ross, thank you. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Do you feel better?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, not really. You’re pressing the baby into my bladder and now I have to pee. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh Rach?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Just one thing umm…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: We live together. You’re having our baby. I’m not gonna see anybody else. Are you-are you sure you don’t want something more?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow! I don’t know, maybe. I’m…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh-oh, Rach! I was just messin’ around! Like you did last night when I had to pee?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I knew that! I knew that! I was just messin’ with you too!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay. Okay. Because for a minute you said you…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh no-no-no-no, no!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: …that you actually…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No that’s just——That’s just ‘cause I’m such a good messer!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Rach?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: The bathroom?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Right!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well I had a great time! Learned how to bake, ate great food, that’s the first A I’ve gotten since seventh grade, and I didn’t have to sleep with the teacher this time.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, look! Acting for Beginners! Want to feel good about yourself?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What the hell!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: The Acting Teacher
utterance.content: All right, let’s start with some basics. Can anybody tell me what the difference between upstage and downstage is?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, this was a stupid idea.
